Denerim: Denerim is considered a holy city by worshippers of some woman with a pointy hat, but not wholly. Participation is never quite at 100%.
Some scholars have suggested that Midian was not a geographical area but a league of tribes. They were all killed, so obviously they were wrong.
As this dye has its origins in Palas, there can be no guarantee that wearing it won't slowly eat away at your skin and then kill you. Consequently, returns of this item will not be accepted.
Colors of The Tower of Inculcation

The Tower of Inculcation is the sort of place you go if your parents have lots of money and would be embarrassed if they didn't spend an average person's salary to send you there. Just keep that to yourself. They aren't the most morally developed people.
Khopesh: Excellent can openers. Inconsistent spelling.
The colors of Forrush were made in tribute to an extremely overrated band of minstrels from the Northern lands. If donning their attire summons them here, the Brazen Head will be most displeased.
The Khopeshi caste known as the Fain are supposedly boat people. Not sentient boats, you understand. They just enjoy a good sail.
The Khopeshi caste known as the Mandesh are... uhh... murder... enthusiasts?
Borphee is a city which, much like the Necropolis, exists within a Zork.
Sandakar made weapons so why in Abraxis' name he's got a clothing line defies explanation. Oh and it seems he did the detail work with rat blood. Lovely
The colors of Postun are worn by people who pay money for a product only to find it incomplete, discarding it in frustration. Except none of them are around to wear these colors so it's on you now.
The Oracle of the Western Machine
Colors of The Oracle of the Western Machine

The Oracle maintains the perpetually spinning Disks of Knowledge whose information she alone can interpret. Access to this information, via the Oracle, is what keeps the Western Machine in motion. Knowledge is power, after all.
Illarnek is a frigid miserable place where everything is frozen, nobody is friendly, and traffic moves at a glacial pace.
This one's for all the geologists out there. And for all the sane people that want to know whom to avoid engaging in conversation.
Sarkomand is a rather difficult and unpleasant place to get to but it's totally worth it for their high quality health care.
Not much is known about the Onyx City except for it's fixation with one particular building material.
The Realm of the King of Dusk
Colors of The Realm of the King of Dusk
The King of Dusk was the most powerful monarch ever elected, but only for a brief segment of every day.

The people of Baphis are blood people.  Blood this, blood that.  Welcome to Baphis, if you don't mind, we're just going to spill the contents of your circulatory system all over the front steps of the Tourism Office.
The Skulking Ghost exists only so long as the living take no notice. Look away, you insensitive monster.
The talents of Zeke's Apprentice are many. Not only does he work in chemistry but he dabbles in fashion as well. Fancy that.
DeadJak is, for all intents and purposes, dead.  He has been adorned in the ritual burial garments of his people and now you can be too.
The Necropolis, being the cheerful place in which you currently find yourself, is an odd choice of affiliation but to each their own.
Acolytes of the Brazen Head can expect to be invited to all the best parties and to be totally protected from death. There is no reason to suspect this is anything less than the truth. Promise.
